posts.title: Former Rep. George Santos sentenced to 87 months in New York federal fraud case
top_comments:
Former Rep. George Santos, whose web of [lies](https://www.cnbc.com/2023/01/19/rep-george-santos-pushes-back-on-insane-reports-he-took-funds-for-veterans-dying-dog.html) about his life led to his expulsion from Congress, was sentenced Friday to more than seven years in prison in his federal fraud case.

The New York Republican must also pay restitution of $373,750, a judge ruled in U.S. District Court in Long Island.

Santos admitted last August to engaging in a multi-pronged campaign finance scheme, stealing unemployment benefits during the Covid-19 pandemic, and lying on House financial disclosure forms.

As part of an agreement with prosecutors, Santos pleaded guilty to a single count each of wire fraud and aggravated identity theft. He also agreed to restitution and forfeiture totaling nearly $580,000.
What a way to treat the man who not only founded New York, but built Central Park with his own three hands.

George Santos is, hands down, the best minor villain America has ever seen. His story is absolutely wild. And not merely because he has a drag-queen alter ego, [Kitara Rivache](https://www.nbcnews.com/nbc-out/out-politics-and-policy/george-santos-says-will-revive-drag-queen-persona-cameo-rcna149867).

The Republican party is an organized crime syndicate. Like the mob, [the GOP happily protected Santos from expulsion](https://apnews.com/article/george-santos-expel-house-republicans-new-york-249bd2341d157bc6727b77607d8d45ae) when he merely deceived voters with financial fraud.

But, Santos broke the most important rule in organized crime: don't steal from the mob. [Santos sent emails to Senator Kevin McCarthy's wealthy donors claiming to be McCarthy's fundraiser. Santos siphoned money from McCarthy's campaign into his own](https://www.cnbc.com/2023/01/09/george-santos-raised-money-from-wealthy-gop-donors-while-lying-about-his-resume.html).

That was the last straw. [Republicans joined Democrats in a second ethics vote against Santos, successfully removing the disgraced representative from Congress](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/who-voted-to-expel-george-santos/).

Federal?

I give it 48 hours until he's pardoned.

Does Vegas have over under on how long he actually spends in prison and is it .5 days cause at this rate I feel it’s more likely the judge who sentenced him somehow is arrested some made up charges than this guy seeing a cell.
Former President Santos going to prison, wow.
The same George Santos that built Rome in a couple days?

To all the snarky “he’s gonna get pardoned” comments, no he fucking isn’t lol. This dude was an absolute nobody before coming into the picture and deeply embarrassed a lot of really powerful people. I could be mistaken but I don’t think a single republican has spoken up in defense of Santos with any meaningful weight beyond maybe a broad platitude about democrats being worse or something. If he didn’t plead guilty they would have 100% thrown the book at him.
his father, the inventor of toaster strudel, will not be very happy with this.
Can’t Cameo his way out of this one.

posts.title: Son of CIA deputy director was killed while fighting for Russia, report says | CIA
top_comments: You'd think that was something that would come up in a routine background check for any position at the CIA.
Ok, so that IS weird, right?

Loved homeland and hated fascism. Fought and died for Putin in the rare conflict that the US is 100 percent on the right side. This makes no fucking sense. This dude must be a really confused individual. Or maybe Russian disinformation machine is just that good.

This is such an odd story. The dude was apparently pro Russia and pro Palestine. In university, he championed gender equality and was very upset with the way the US supported Israel. 

How the fuck can you have all those views and then go fight for Putin? I'm flabbergasted. Flummoxed.

So he was an "America Bad" left-wing contrarian who hated "imperialism" so much that he gave his life to support a Russian war of expansion.

This is your brain on social media
McCarthyism would have had this dude for breakfast
Died doing what he loved, being a fucking idiot.

Oh well, anyway.   
   
I'm having chicken parm for dinner tonight. You?

Tankies and braindead upper-middle-class kids with a rebellious streak (they're the same picture) supporting horrific authoritarian regimes against all logic and self-interest isn't anything new. 

Play stupid games, win stupid prizes.
What a waste of a comfortable life.

posts.title: FBI arrests Wisconsin judge for alleged immigration arrest obstruction
top_comments:
Find this beyond alarming given he fully pardoned a judge in Nevada who was caught red handed pocketing money raised for a police memorial. Was an open and shut case. 

She said it was god’s doing and borderline called Trump a deity. I shit you not. She’s back in court like next week.
That's 2 judges in 2 days.

Meanwhile, trump recently pardoned a judge in Nevada who committed fraud related to a ~~veterans charity~~ honoring a slain police officer. 

If that didn’t enrage you enough, that judge had no law degree and said she was looking forward to getting back on the bench.

Edit: she stole money that was supposed to go to a fund for a slain officer for personal expenses.....like plastic surgery. 

From ABC

*President Trump has pardoned a Las Vegas politician convicted last year of using money meant for a statue honoring a slain police officer on personal costs, including plastic surgery.*

*Michele Fiore, a former city councilwoman and Nevada state lawmaker, was* [*found guilty in October*](https://apnews.com/article/republican-michele-fiore-guilty-wire-fraud-nevada-5844d79dacf0bfd6b43d36e03eb6cd95) *of six counts of federal wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud. She was out of custody ahead of a sentencing scheduled for next month.*

*Federal prosecutors alleged during trial that Fiore, 54, had raised more than $70,000 for the statue of a Las Vegas police officer who was fatally shot in 2014 in the line of duty, but had instead spent some of the funds on cosmetic surgery, rent and her daughter's wedding.*

*Fiore, who does not have a law degree, was appointed as a judge in deep-red Nye County in 2022 shortly after she lost her campaign for state treasurer. She was elected in June 2024 to complete the unexpired term of a judge who died but had been suspended without pay amid her legal troubles. Pahrump is an hour's drive west of Las Vegas.*
Is this record time to go from "Stop overreacting" to "we are literally arresting judges"
Just want to add a historical note that in the Declaration of Independence there is a mention that if a government becomes oppressive, the people have the right to abolish it.

So Trump is sending his crony at the FBI, Kash Patel, to arrest judges standing up to him.

*Yeah, that's definitely the sign of a properly functioning democracy.*
Guys? You're under reacting. way under reacting
Everyone in this administration deserves to end up in prison when this is all over.
Time for the National Strikes to begin. If they are arresting judges now for upholding the law, there is nothing left for this country. Time to shut it all down.

>Patel wrote on X that the FBI believes Milwaukee Circuit Court Judge Hannah Dugan “intentionally misdirected federal agents away” from Eduardo Flores Ruiz as agents were attempting to arrest him at her courthouse last week.

It’s not what you believe, it’s what you can prove. It will be interesting to see what kind of case they have but my money is on the FBI over reaching here.

posts.title: Exclusive: White House wants to defund independent Social Security board, sources say
top_comments: The Trump administration wants to defund the American people.

A little tiny piece at a time until they finally say, we tried to tell you Social Security was collapsing! Thanks Obama! 

  And the idiots believe it and vote for more tax cuts for billionaires.
Haven't Republicans used about a trillion dollars from the social security to pay for things they don't want to budget? Starting with the Reagan administration? Are they going to pay that back?
Social Security will be dead before the end of the year.
Cutting social security will be what turns people (probably violently) against this administration.

Defund anything for the have-nots while increasing things for the haves? What a novel approach! I wonder why this hasn't been used over the millennia? Isn't it fantastic that we have Trump to show us what happens when we allow malignant narcissistic sociopathic grifters to take over?   /s
I find it very strange that the American people don't up their game against the fascist.
Of fucking course he does. Bastard.
The Trump administration wants to destroy American democracy.

So after a judge was removed today by the FBI, I’d say it’s time to start talking about military compliance or preparing a militia. They’re not going to stop until they’re physically stopped. We are on the brink of civil war but the left isn’t exactly weapon happy. There needs to be preparation.

posts.title: ICE is reversing termination of legal status for international students around US, lawyers say
top_comments: Monday headlines: Trump tells ICE to revoke legal status.  Tuesday headline- ICE reverts status once again.

It's not going to matter much. The uncertainty around it just makes everything worse.

We have an administration who shrugs when they accidentally deport the wrong person, actively goes after judges in every way they can, and I wouldn't be surprised to see issuing brown boots to ICE.

The world has seen what we are becoming, even if a dark part of our own population is in denial about it.

I’m tired of hearing fatalist remarks about how this doesn’t matter. We can’t secede our power and need to keep the fight going. Inch by inch, if necessary. This is a good sign that the administration is responding to legal action and pushback.
The protests are working. If you go to them, keep it up.

This was always evil and cruel. 

But on a dumber level, this shit is WASTEFUL and EXPENSIVE. 

This messy administration and DOGE boys will cost us billions and billions at the end of the day. Because all of this costs us time and money.

Lol they are about to find out how much international students' exorbitant tuitions subsidy domestic students'. You think paying for colleges as an American is too expensive? Without international students you're gonna pay double the current rate.

So, basically... "We have absolutely no legal foundation for our actions, so rather than set a legal precedent we'll just voluntarily reverse our decision."

I'm hardly an expert on such matters, but from what I understand from credible sources, is that even if your student visa is terminated, you're legally allowed to remain in the country as long as you're enrolled at a school. I presume at least until the end of the current term, then you're expected to either get a new visa or leave.
Because it is illegal to do since none committed a crime.
They already accomplished their objective. Nobody wants to study in this shit hole country anymore, so our universities will be starved of international students who pay full tuition
Trumps goons were acting unlawfully. Colour me surprised.

top_comments:
So Elon musk, who has several years worth of history of posting nazi propaganda on Twitter, is sueing because a law saw people can't use AI to create deepfakes to intentionally spread political misinformation.

I mean, aside from all the other awful shit he has done, does anyone really need anymore proof musk is an evil narcissistic psycho?
In the spirit of Musk's concerns: Never, ever stop creating and posting deep fakes of Elon Musk openly bragging about rigging the 2024 election.
Sueing to spread political disinformation sounds like a stupid idea and only proves that you and your platform shouldn't be trusted.
He's suing for the right to deliberately mislead and lie to people. P. O. S.
Musk is only filing suit because he personally would be responsible for generating most of it.

I'm so sick of malignant narcissist billionaires.

*I apologize for being redundant though.*
That guy is a taint barnacle
Elons just doing this to fuck with Tim Walz

He's such a little bitch. 
Just a complete coward on every fucking level.

"“requirements are so vague and unintelligible that social media platforms cannot understand what the statute permits and what it prohibits"

Uh... maybe don't make shit up? How is that so fucking difficult to understand?

posts.title: Luigi Mangione pleads not guilty in federal court to murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO
top_comments: Death penalty for thee, but not for the guy that killed 12 people recently in a shooting.
Well that’s good enough for me, knock it down to rolling a stop sign and cut him loose.

The aristocracy is really unhappy that one of their own was targeted, and public sentiment leaned towards the attacker. They're trying to make an example of him. Mass murdering terrorists didn't catch federal charges with a death penalty.
Why did his case even go to federal court when it all happened in New York?
Now bring the real murderers to trial - Health Insurance CEOs and their Boards.
How about we split the difference and call it medical malpractice?

Think they are really pushing that "innocent man" jargon. The CEO of UnitedHealthcare was NOT an innocent man by any means. 

I think pretty much everyone  in health insurance company leadership roles need  criminal charges for "theft by deception" and should be charged for manslaughter for all the people that died bc they were unable to be diagnosed and/or treated for the illnesses and injuries that killed them, bc the insurance companies wouldn't cover the testing/diagnostics/treatment. 

And I think if our elected reps had the same type of health insurance we did, they would change their tune pretty quick.
We're all looking for the guy that did this.
my man didn’t do shit
Case closed.  He's innocent. Don't know if we'll ever figure this one out but the important thing is that we tried.

posts.title: Russian general killed in car blast hours before US envoy’s Kremlin meeting
top_comments: Imagine scheduling peace talks and getting met with *“please hold, your general has exploded.”*
He shouldn't have provoked the bomb, if he didn't want to be blown up.
Are ya'll just finding out about this? Some dude named Pete texted me about it days ago.
Was he supposed to meet with Vance. He’s the harbinger of death
First thing I thought was, who did it. Ukrainians, anti war Russians, or Putin himself?
Oh well. No harm done.
Ukraine lurking in the Signal chats.
Finally some good news
Looks better than a window lintel, doesn't it?
Have they tried asking the the bomb to "STOP IT"?

posts.title: US prosecutors to seek death penalty against Luigi Mangione in UnitedHealth executive’s murder
top_comments:
Mass shooter at a school? Life in prison.


Kill a rich person? DEATH PENALTY.

They want to make an example out of him. Shame that our government cares more about the life of one CEO than it does about the wellbeing of its citizens who are forced to rely on substandard health insurance coverage and labyrinthian claims processes.

In justifying their decision, prosecutors wrote in their filing that Mangione "presents a future danger because he expressed an intent to target an entire industry, and rally political and social opposition to that industry, by engaging in an act of lethal violence."

Interesting to note that racially motivated mass shooters don't get the prosecutors this bloodthirsty for a death penalty case (and the cops will take them out for burger king on the way to jail in some cases!)
Oh, they're making an example all right lol. The example being that if you have nothing to lose, may as well take out a rich fucker or two on the way out. Fucking idiots.

>Mr Mangione is facing 11 state criminal counts in New York, including first-degree murder and murder as a crime of terrorism.


>But federal prosecutors have also separately charged Mr Mangione for using a firearm to commit murder and interstate stalking resulting in death. These charges make him eligible for the death penalty.

Far be it from me to want to bring up DOGE, but if the state has a really good case, why is the federal government piling on and wasting taxpayer money? It's possible *if* something jury nullification comes into play and the accused is acquitted on all charges on the state level, the federal government can still step in and charge this man for the crimes listed above. But that's only if something like an acquittal happens at the state level, for something like jury nullification.
Is it normal for the attorney general to taint a trial by calling the defendant a murderer on live TV? You know, before any juries have been selected?
are we even sure he did it
Last i checked a significant amount of school shooters have not gotten the death penalty?
They just gave the highland park shooter life in prison for killing 7 and injuring atleast a dozen others but this dude gets one rich dude and they'll probably chop his head off on live TV

posts.title: Man convicted of first-degree murder in rock-throwing death of Colorado driver
top_comments: Shit like this makes your blood boil. I cannot imagine how I'd feel if a loved one died to this kind of absolutely senseless buffoonery. Fuck them all. Throw the whole damn kitchen sink.

> After seeing Bartell’s car leave the road after being hit, the three friends circled back a few times to look again, according to testimony and investigators. One of them, Kwak, took a photo as a memento but no one checked on the driver or called for help, according to their testimony.

> Bartell’s body would not be discovered until her girlfriend, Jenna Griggs, who was on the phone with her that night when the call abruptly cut out, tracked her phone to the field, she testified.

tl;dr: Not only did they do this, they had saw the results, had the chance to save them... not only didn't, but took a photo and just left them there.

Edit: Fixed, ty jojo
Wow, finally pieces of crap like this get sentences that fit the crime

>Karol-Chik testified that Koenig seemed “excited” as they drove by Bartell’s car and at one point made a “whoop” sound.

>“It sounded like him celebrating,” said Karol-Chik, who admitted he had placed the fatal rock next to Koenig so he could grab it and throw it as he drove.

Thankfully I will never understand these sorts of people.

The detail “the friends agreed to not talk to anyone after the event” is actually super important in these cases. It signifies that they had some understanding between right and wrong during the moment of the crime. This makes it almost impossible to make an insanity argument, which the defense attorney most definitely would have attempted on the basis of his “borderline personality disorder.”

>Koenig’s attorneys argued he did not know anyone had been hurt until Bartell’s car went off the road and that he had borderline personality disorder, which affected his impulse control and judgment.

Using neurodivergency as an excuse for bad behavior is a tough sell. You're admitting that you can't be trusted and shouldn't be left alone. I think it's BS, but either way, he can't be let to walk around free.
Genuinely (and pleasantly) surprised the other two are also receiving actual lengthy sentences. Seems like it’s always “pled guilty to second degree murder, sentenced to time served”.

*After seeing Bartell’s car leave the road after being hit, the three friends circled back a few times to look again, according to testimony and investigators. One of them, Kwak,* [*took a photo*](https://apnews.com/article/colorado-driver-rock-throwing-death-9ed6bb5ef63212cd58a6d51e94596f18) *as a memento but no one checked on the driver or called for help, according to their testimony.*

This Kwak action seems almost as callous as throwing the fateful stone. But Bartell's mother, while happy that justice for her daughter was achieved, still felt mixed emotions and some sympathy with the defendants plight.

"...but also stressed that none of the three had intended to hurt anyone."

What did they intend when they threw a rock at the windscreen of a moving car? 

After it crashed and they took a photo of the wreck, then left without calling for an ambulance, were they still not intending any hurt?

When my older sister was a baby, my parents took her to the zoo and had her in a stroller. There’s a tall bridge that goes over part of the zoo. Some idiot threw a hubcap off of the bridge and it landed within 10’ of my parents & sister. So fucking reckless and idiotic to do.

This woman lost her life because of their idiocy, and now they are essentially losing their lives because of their idiocy.

posts.title: Former Rep. George Santos sentenced to 87 months in New York federal fraud case
top_comments:
Former Rep. George Santos, whose web of [lies](https://www.cnbc.com/2023/01/19/rep-george-santos-pushes-back-on-insane-reports-he-took-funds-for-veterans-dying-dog.html) about his life led to his expulsion from Congress, was sentenced Friday to more than seven years in prison in his federal fraud case.

Santos admitted last August to engaging in a multi-pronged campaign finance scheme, stealing unemployment benefits during the Covid-19 pandemic, and lying on House financial disclosure forms.

posts.title: UK scientists to launch outdoor geoengineering experiments | Geoengineering | The Guardian
top_comments:
Unless the geoengineering takes the form of absorbing more carbon from the environment, at best it's going to change the environment in different ways. A high CO2 environment that has the same temperature as before is not the same as a pre-industrial environment. And then you add the side-effects from what's used to bring the temperature down.

If the geoengineering stops being maintained, temperatures go right back up (more if more CO2's been released).
I think we've all seen enough Sci-Fi movies to know how this song and dance goes.

The problem is the people with money are never going to allow this on a meaningful scale. Drill baby drill is their motiff. And they will suck the Earth dry for profit even if it is the death of us all.

posts.title: FBI arrests Wisconsin judge for alleged immigration arrest obstruction
top_comments:
Find this beyond alarming given he fully pardoned a judge in Nevada who was caught red handed pocketing money raised for a police memorial. Was an open and shut case. 

She said it was god’s doing and borderline called Trump a deity. I shit you not. She’s back in court like next week.
That's 2 judges in 2 days.

Meanwhile, trump recently pardoned a judge in Nevada who committed fraud related to a ~~veterans charity~~ honoring a slain police officer. 

If that didn’t enrage you enough, that judge had no law degree and said she was looking forward to getting back on the bench.

Edit: she stole money that was supposed to go to a fund for a slain officer for personal expenses.....like plastic surgery. 

From ABC

*President Trump has pardoned a Las Vegas politician convicted last year of using money meant for a statue honoring a slain police officer on personal costs, including plastic surgery.*

*Michele Fiore, a former city councilwoman and Nevada state lawmaker, was* [*found guilty in October*](https://apnews.com/article/republican-michele-fiore-guilty-wire-fraud-nevada-5844d79dacf0bfd6b43d36e03eb6cd95) *of six counts of federal wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud. She was out of custody ahead of a sentencing scheduled for next month.*

*Federal prosecutors alleged during trial that Fiore, 54, had raised more than $70,000 for the statue of a Las Vegas police officer who was fatally shot in 2014 in the line of duty, but had instead spent some of the funds on cosmetic surgery, rent and her daughter's wedding.*

*Fiore, who does not have a law degree, was appointed as a judge in deep-red Nye County in 2022 shortly after she lost her campaign for state treasurer. She was elected in June 2024 to complete the unexpired term of a judge who died but had been suspended without pay amid her legal troubles. Pahrump is an hour's drive west of Las Vegas.*
Is this record time to go from "Stop overreacting" to "we are literally arresting judges"
Just want to add a historical note that in the Declaration of Independence there is a mention that if a government becomes oppressive, the people have the right to abolish it.

So Trump is sending his crony at the FBI, Kash Patel, to arrest judges standing up to him.

*Yeah, that's definitely the sign of a properly functioning democracy.*
Guys? You're under reacting. way under reacting
Everyone in this administration deserves to end up in prison when this is all over.
Time for the National Strikes to begin. If they are arresting judges now for upholding the law, there is nothing left for this country. Time to shut it all down.

>Patel wrote on X that the FBI believes Milwaukee Circuit Court Judge Hannah Dugan “intentionally misdirected federal agents away” from Eduardo Flores Ruiz as agents were attempting to arrest him at her courthouse last week.

It’s not what you believe, it’s what you can prove. It will be interesting to see what kind of case they have but my money is on the FBI over reaching here.

posts.title: ICE is reversing termination of legal status for international students around US, lawyers say
top_comments: Monday headlines: Trump tells ICE to revoke legal status.  Tuesday headline- ICE reverts status once again.

It's not going to matter much. The uncertainty around it just makes everything worse.

We have an administration who shrugs when they accidentally deport the wrong person, actively goes after judges in every way they can, and I wouldn't be surprised to see issuing brown boots to ICE.

The world has seen what we are becoming, even if a dark part of our own population is in denial about it.

I’m tired of hearing fatalist remarks about how this doesn’t matter. We can’t secede our power and need to keep the fight going. Inch by inch, if necessary. This is a good sign that the administration is responding to legal action and pushback.
The protests are working. If you go to them, keep it up.

This was always evil and cruel. 

But on a dumber level, this shit is WASTEFUL and EXPENSIVE. 

This messy administration and DOGE boys will cost us billions and billions at the end of the day. Because all of this costs us time and money.

Lol they are about to find out how much international students' exorbitant tuitions subsidy domestic students'. You think paying for colleges as an American is too expensive? Without international students you're gonna pay double the current rate.

So, basically... "We have absolutely no legal foundation for our actions, so rather than set a legal precedent we'll just voluntarily reverse our decision."

I'm hardly an expert on such matters, but from what I understand from credible sources, is that even if your student visa is terminated, you're legally allowed to remain in the country as long as you're enrolled at a school. I presume at least until the end of the current term, then you're expected to either get a new visa or leave.
Because it is illegal to do since none committed a crime.
They already accomplished their objective. Nobody wants to study in this shit hole country anymore, so our universities will be starved of international students who pay full tuition

posts.title: Man convicted of first-degree murder in rock-throwing death of Colorado driver
top_comments: Shit like this makes your blood boil. I cannot imagine how I'd feel if a loved one died to this kind of absolutely senseless buffoonery. Fuck them all. Throw the whole damn kitchen sink.

> After seeing Bartell’s car leave the road after being hit, the three friends circled back a few times to look again, according to testimony and investigators. One of them, Kwak, took a photo as a memento but no one checked on the driver or called for help, according to their testimony.

> Bartell’s body would not be discovered until her girlfriend, Jenna Griggs, who was on the phone with her that night when the call abruptly cut out, tracked her phone to the field, she testified.

tl;dr: Not only did they do this, they had saw the results, had the chance to save them... not only didn't, but took a photo and just left them there.

Edit: Fixed, ty jojo
Wow, finally pieces of crap like this get sentences that fit the crime

>Karol-Chik testified that Koenig seemed “excited” as they drove by Bartell’s car and at one point made a “whoop” sound.

>“It sounded like him celebrating,” said Karol-Chik, who admitted he had placed the fatal rock next to Koenig so he could grab it and throw it as he drove.

Thankfully I will never understand these sorts of people.

The detail “the friends agreed to not talk to anyone after the event” is actually super important in these cases. It signifies that they had some understanding between right and wrong during the moment of the crime. This makes it almost impossible to make an insanity argument, which the defense attorney most definitely would have attempted on the basis of his “borderline personality disorder.”

>Koenig’s attorneys argued he did not know anyone had been hurt until Bartell’s car went off the road and that he had borderline personality disorder, which affected his impulse control and judgment.

Using neurodivergency as an excuse for bad behavior is a tough sell. You're admitting that you can't be trusted and shouldn't be left alone. I think it's BS, but either way, he can't be let to walk around free.
Genuinely (and pleasantly) surprised the other two are also receiving actual lengthy sentences. Seems like it’s always “pled guilty to second degree murder, sentenced to time served”.

*After seeing Bartell’s car leave the road after being hit, the three friends circled back a few times to look again, according to testimony and investigators. One of them, Kwak,* [*took a photo*](https://apnews.com/article/colorado-driver-rock-throwing-death-9ed6bb5ef63212cd58a6d51e94596f18) *as a memento but no one checked on the driver or called for help, according to their testimony.*

This Kwak action seems almost as callous as throwing the fateful stone. But Bartell's mother, while happy that justice for her daughter was achieved, still felt mixed emotions and some sympathy with the defendants plight.

"...but also stressed that none of the three had intended to hurt anyone."

What did they intend when they threw a rock at the windscreen of a moving car? 

After it crashed and they took a photo of the wreck, then left without calling for an ambulance, were they still not intending any hurt?

When my older sister was a baby, my parents took her to the zoo and had her in a stroller. There’s a tall bridge that goes over part of the zoo. Some idiot threw a hubcap off of the bridge and it landed within 10’ of my parents & sister. So fucking reckless and idiotic to do.

This woman lost her life because of their idiocy, and now they are essentially losing their lives because of their idiocy.

posts.title: Former Rep. George Santos sentenced to 87 months in New York federal fraud case
top_comments:
Former Rep. George Santos, whose web of [lies](https://www.cnbc.com/2023/01/19/rep-george-santos-pushes-back-on-insane-reports-he-took-funds-for-veterans-dying-dog.html) about his life led to his expulsion from Congress, was sentenced Friday to more than seven years in prison in his federal fraud case.

The New York Republican must also pay restitution of $373,750, a judge ruled in U.S. District Court in Long Island.

Santos admitted last August to engaging in a multi-pronged campaign finance scheme, stealing unemployment benefits during the Covid-19 pandemic, and lying on House financial disclosure forms.

As part of an agreement with prosecutors, Santos pleaded guilty to a single count each of wire fraud and aggravated identity theft. He also agreed to restitution and forfeiture totaling nearly $580,000.

posts.title: US prosecutors to seek death penalty against Luigi Mangione in UnitedHealth executive’s murder
top_comments:
Mass shooter at a school? Life in prison.


Kill a rich person? DEATH PENALTY.

They want to make an example out of him. Shame that our government cares more about the life of one CEO than it does about the wellbeing of its citizens who are forced to rely on substandard health insurance coverage and labyrinthian claims processes.

In justifying their decision, prosecutors wrote in their filing that Mangione "presents a future danger because he expressed an intent to target an entire industry, and rally political and social opposition to that industry, by engaging in an act of lethal violence."

Interesting to note that racially motivated mass shooters don't get the prosecutors this bloodthirsty for a death penalty case (and the cops will take them out for burger king on the way to jail in some cases!)
Oh, they're making an example all right lol. The example being that if you have nothing to lose, may as well take out a rich fucker or two on the way out. Fucking idiots.

>Mr Mangione is facing 11 state criminal counts in New York, including first-degree murder and murder as a crime of terrorism.


>But federal prosecutors have also separately charged Mr Mangione for using a firearm to commit murder and interstate stalking resulting in death. These charges make him eligible for the death penalty.

Far be it from me to want to bring up DOGE, but if the state has a really good case, why is the federal government piling on and wasting taxpayer money? It's possible *if* something jury nullification comes into play and the accused is acquitted on all charges on the state level, the federal government can still step in and charge this man for the crimes listed above. But that's only if something like an acquittal happens at the state level, for something like jury nullification.
Is it normal for the attorney general to taint a trial by calling the defendant a murderer on live TV? You know, before any juries have been selected?
are we even sure he did it
Last i checked a significant amount of school shooters have not gotten the death penalty?
They just gave the highland park shooter life in prison for killing 7 and injuring atleast a dozen others but this dude gets one rich dude and they'll probably chop his head off on live TV
